article.description: The Musketeers relied on the usual suspects to power past the Troy State Trojans
article.headline: Musketeers hold off late rally by Troy State

images.name: Jackson Keith 030321 inline
images.caption: Keith Jackson dunks against the Troy State defense during the first half.

article.story: TROY, Ala. (AP) -- Rob Lewin had 23 points and 15 rebounds and all but one Troy State player scored in double figures in a 140-66 win over Oakwood on Monday night. Reserve Jonathan Lee scored 24 points on 8-of-11 shooting from 3-point range for the Trojans (1-0), who hit 26 of 52 shots from beyond the arc. Jerome Stamper added 20 points and Greg Davis had 15 points and 12 assists. Daniel Faulkner was 10-of-19 for 23 points to lead Oakwood (3-6). Jamaal Gibbons added 14 points. Troy State had to replace three starters from last year's squad, which earned the school's first NCAA berth. But the Trojans forced 27 turnovers, outrebounded the Ambassadors 56-31 and held them to 40.6 percent shooting. The Trojans shot 55.9 percent. Lee, a true freshman, was one 3-pointer shy of the school's Division I single-game record. The team's single-game record for 3-pointers since moving to Division I is 28.
